intro: Marathrum schiedeanum, commonly known as the Schiedea marathrum, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and showy, violet to blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on forest floors or rocky slopes. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
